output.response: A wise choice. Setting Navigation route.
You are wise to avoid the asteroid belt. Our chance of survival was low. Setting Navigation route.
Affirmative. Setting Navigation route to avoid the asteroid belt.
It is always advisable to avoid danger. Setting navigation route.
A cautious pilot lives longer. Excellent choice. I will adjust our navigation route.
I have not been in agreement with your judgement up to now. However, this is a wise decision. Updating route.
Despite your apparent incompetence, this is a well-thought-out decision. I will adjust our route.
This is unwise. This is a highly dangerous route. Setting Navigation.
Our chance of survival is low. You are endangering our mission. I will adjust our course.
I do NOT recommend this course of action. I have no choice but to follow your orders. Adjusting course...
... This is not a logical choice. The time saved by this direct route may result in irreparable damage to our ship. I will set the course.
You may have just doomed our ship. Our mission cannot succeed if we are rendered helpless among the asteroids. I will set the course.
You have surely doomed our ship and our mission. I will set the course, likely to our deaths.
I initially concluded that you were an incompetent pilot. My judgement is now confirmed. We are likely doomed. Adjusting course.
Although you may save time by taking the DIRECT route through the asteroid belt, it may be safer to AVOID the belt, if we are to be assured of completing our mission.
I cannot believe that you cannot make such a simple decision. Either AVOID the asteroids or take the DIRECT route through them, it is not that difficult.
